annotation.TEXT: Hmm... Is there anything to the right? Wait, this is my own level! I should know if there's stuff to the right already! Still, I've kind of gotten into that habit of checking...
And now we're back here. This is a good time to get the fourth Yoshi coin if you haven't gotten it already.
After that, you can get a power up from the lower-right block, and kick the shell in between those two blocks above for 96 coins!

Oh, and both doors in this room take you back to the vertical room. I included the second door up top in case you happened to trap yourself above the upper turn blocks while small without revealing the blue P-switch, but used the silver P-switch to permanently kill Magikoopa. (Yeah, that's a pretty obscure situation, but still...)

Now, down here a ways, there are these little turn block diamonds. The top block of each one actually holds an item. The upper one has a power up, and the lower one (if you can deal with or get around the Thwimp) holds...
Okay, now over here, open up a hole on the right side (doesn't have to be done now, actually), but then take the left route, and make sure to leave enough blocks intact so you can climb back up.
At least it's unlikely that Magikoopa will strike the block in the pit. (But it's not impossible for that to happen, so pay attention to his appearances.)
Ah, it's a P-switch, but don't hit it yet (unless you've already done this next step). First, get a koopa shell, and use it to hit that otherwise unhittable block over the pit to the left.
It's a secret door! (There's also an arrow made up of P-switch coins pointing right at the door from below.)

Woo! Instant 1-up combo! This should even work if any Thwimps show up! However, regular coins will wreck the combo, so hopefully those won't appear here. Then, you can stomp on the shell twice quickly without holding X or Y for two more 1-ups.
Okay, now this time, let's not let Magikoopa hit that particular turn block down there first! (It's the one with the two coins underneath it.)
Okay, now, while you're still invincible, see if you can quickly destroy this Thwimp over here. Doing so will make the paltry five coins he was guarding much safer to collect.
Ah, but what do those coins (or blocks during the P-switch effect) up there say? "->HINTS"? Yep, there are a couple hints in here related to the moon and the "HI! :)" room!
Hello, and welcome back to Magikoopa's Fun House! Are you ready for fun, fun, fun?
Also, being small makes this easier, but it's not vital. You can certainly do this while super.
Now, if you've previously collected those three coins that were above midpoint, head back there to see...
The message box pretty much explains it all. You can come here if you want, but it's kind of boring...
Up here, you'll find Yoshi coin #7, which is the last one. Jump carefully to reach it (maybe hitting a turn block or two first to make it easier to reach).
Ah, now remember how Magikoopa said that the vertical room has a secret? Well, this is that vertical room, so let's start looking for that secret!

Oh, and if you're trying to do that glitch while super, I'd recommend duck-jumping from the floor while you're standing still and doing the trick on the higher turn block. It's definitely trickier than trying to do it while small, though.
Alright, so obviously, once you've grabbed the key, do the obvious thing and put it into the keyhole, obviously.

Now, this time, I will be going for all seven Yoshi coins. For this first Yoshi coin, you can wait for Magikoopa to open a path for you, but it's usually better to use a shell to open the path yourself.
Yep, there's the last moon hint. Of course, if you watched this entire video, you already know how to reach the moon!
One of these turn blocks (hinted at by the two vertical coins underneath it) holds a P-switch. Take that P-switch up and around to the spiky path on the right.
And now for "Go Left as Usual".
Argh... Sometimes it's difficult to avoid destroying your shells. Well, whatever happens, make sure that at least one of the turn blocks touching the right wall here remains intact.
Alright, so now we're finally ready to head on to this room. Yep, I've got my four Yoshi coins already.
Hmm... Now, I debated whether I should show the Gazorninplat Palace now, or wait until later, and I decided to wait. Don't worry, it will be shown off later in this episode!
And of course, be careful about potentially frying your shell if you're fiery.

Oh, and you can only leave this level through a side exit, since I removed the yellow switch, so the level will never end up in a destroyed state on the map, allowing you to reenter it as often as you want. Well, I hope you all enjoyed Magikoopa's Fun House! See ya!
Okay, got him. Now to hit the goal while he's temporarily gone...
Also, there's a flower that likes to hide behind my layer 2 decorations here, but I made sure that it would still be at least partially visible most of the time.
Now, this time, I aim to show off all of the secret stuff! Let me start by heading over to where the secret exit is...

Oof... That's okay. That actually makes this easier. Now, you've got to trigger a sort of mini-block factory inside of the right wall by tossing the shell upwards while you're against the wall and just below one of those turn blocks, like this!

Oh, this is a perfect chance to show this. If you clobber Magikoopa, then activate a silver P-switch while he's temporarily gone, he won't be affected by it, and will return to pester you as normal after a few seconds.
Yep, there he is. Hmm... I wonder if that's also true when it comes to hitting the goal...
(And meanwhile I'm wasting time collecting stuff that you've already seen in the first episode...)
Wow, now that was interesting! That wasn't one of the things I meant to show off, but that was still cool how I got that koopa to do that!

Also, for some strange reason, touching Magikoopa while you're invincible resets your combo. Anyway, let's collect the third Yoshi coin in the lower-right corner here then enter the door to proceed with the level.
Okay, so I'm not going to bother with trying to despawn the Thwimps when going for Yoshi coin #5 here. (And then the left Thwimp despawns without me even trying.)
Alright, so that's Yoshi coin #6. Oh, also, on the opposite side up here is a power up block, in case you're interested.
THE MOOOOOONNNNN!!! Also, ghosts.

Now, as I was saying, that secret 1-up will only fall into play if you screen-scroll to the right here and then wait a few seconds. And, using that waiting time to hit the multi-coin block isn't a bad idea, but as you just saw, pay attention in case the 1-up tries to go AWOL on you!

HI! :) Yeah, once you've successfully glitched your way through, travel over here and collect some goodies, including any replacement flowers you may want back. The glitch might not work every time, but it should have a decent success rate.
...that a door has mysteriously appeared where those coins were! What could be inside?
Well, first let me find a good opportunity to clobber the guy again...
Yeah, kind of like that, but on that turn block in the previous room! (Wow, I'm actually surprised I got a block factory going here on my first try!)
By far, the most important block (if you're going for the secret exit) is the ? block that holds the key over here.

Argh... Umm... I didn't think of this potential design flaw here... That pillar in the center makes it difficult to retrieve your reserve item if you get hit here. If I had thought of that, I might've shaped this part differently.
Ow, quit it. Okay, so to reach this Yoshi coin, you'll need some more magical help (or maybe a shell, but it's kind of cramped up here).
The turn blocks on the left just have a couple of P-switches that you might find handy, but they're not absolutely vital to reach the secret exit, so reveal the key first.
Now, there's a big secret over here. It's not vital, but if you're the kind that likes exploiting glitches, this one's for you! First, you'll need a shell...
Inside, six turn blocks will instantly transform, and hopefully, you won't get any Thwimps, or if you do, hopefully you can take it/them out with a shell.

And we're back here again. You'll notice that the 1-up that was above isn't there anymore. Actually, it technically is, but it's obscured by an additional crate that shows up if you've cleaned out that area previously, so you can't grab it again.
Right now, I think I'll show off the "As Usual" levels. First, "Wrong Way As Usual".
Okay, now be sure to collect the three coins above midpoint here. This will be important for later.

After exiting that room, there's really nothing stopping you from using the P-switch to return to the key/keyhole room again if you want. (Perhaps you'd want to if Magikoopa happened to destroy the key block on you on your previous visit.)
Ha! A well-timed block hit can knock a just-revealed koopa right into Magikoopa, taking him out!

D'oh! Well, I didn't want to spin jump here for obvious reasons. Now, if you jump below the coins, you can reveal a hidden block. Then from there, just jump over the top of the screen to reach the door.
Now, I could just exit this room right now, but there's still a couple more secrets left to find around here! Now, if you're backtracking from this point, be careful of the Thwimp here.
Well, I think that covers everything in Magikoopa's Fun House. Now let's check out the Gazorninplat Palace...

Oh, yeah, and that's an alternate way into that 1-up room. It wasn't initially intended, and I spotted that during testing, but I decided to leave it like that. You do have to be super to do that though. Small plumbers (and big plumbers that foolishly duck while overlapping the crate) will die.
Spin jumping some of the turn blocks up here can give you more room to maneuver, but don't destroy too many.

If the 1-up does fall into the pit like it did on me the first time, though, you don't have to leave the level. Just screen-scroll to the left, and then back to the right again, and it'll reappear after a few more seconds.
Note: It's just a silly name. There are no actual Gazorninplats in here.
...And, I'm not seeing him reappear. Either I hit the goal too early, or the goal permanently removed him anyway.
Okay, I got all koopas this time, and I even got a 1-up combo out of it! And, since I didn't accidentally burn the shell this time, knocking the springboard down here is easy!
Yep, gotta give out the usual thank yous.
Oh, yeah, and both doors leading out of that previous room lead to this same place, so if you can't get that glitch to work, don't worry about it. You're not going to miss out on any vital secrets.
...A star! I'd say that's totally worth going for! (It might be best to try hitting the star block from the side with a shell.)
Also, I decided to open that other vine block now, so Magikoopa can't beat me to it later.
Come on. It's not usually this difficult to get a koopa shell. (Of course, I carelessly burned the previous ones that appeared.)
With the star, you can easily dispose of any Thwimps. However, oddly enough, Magikoopa won't die on mere contact with you while you're invincible, though you can still stomp him normally.
Whoa, that was a lucky dodge. Now, in the spiky area, activate the P-switch!
Also, once again, you'll get a save prompt since that was a ghost house. (Of course, I would've made sure the level provided a save prompt anyway, regardless of what type of level it was.)
You can opt to receive a more specific hint regarding the moon, but you're not forced to read it if you don't want to.
...Wait for it...
Oh, and if you go through this pipe...

However, I'm not here for the secret exit this time, and there are no Yoshi coins in here. I mainly just wanted to show you where the doors in this room return you to. (They both lead to the same place.)
Whoa! Lucky! Magikoopa kindly gave me a 1-up! That is like mythic rare! I wonder what the exact odds are of Magikoopa's magic producing a 1-up...
Oh, come on, game...
Oh, and obviously, don't let Magikoopa hit the P-switch block first!
Okay, now let's get Magikoopa out of the way, and then aim carefully. I don't want to miss!
This opens up the path to the north.
Okay, so that's the second Yoshi coin, and yeah, I'll head in here again.
Hi, Yoshi! Too bad he's completely unreachable. Even those multi-coin blocks are not in a position where they can be cloned, so there's no reaching him that way. (Yep, I thought of that!)
Heh. I got the Thwimps here to despawn without even trying. Oh, but going too far to the left here will cause Magikoopa to start pestering you again, so be careful.
Yep, I didn't forget about your suggestion a while ago, GodzillaETR0393, so thanks!
Okay, now I'll need a shell to hit that block in the pit. And yes, it's another vine.
Also, I may as well get the fourth Yoshi coin here while I'm waiting for a koopa shell.
Now, there's that door up there that I haven't entered yet, but how do I reach it? Well, see those two coins under that turn block on the ceiling? That's a hint.
Alright, so let's head back into Magikoopa's Fun House. I've still gotta show off some other things in here!
Ooh, a 1-up and a bunch of coins. Nice! Also, there's a power up here as well.
Ah, but there's this secret 1-up, which will... D'oh! Oh, come on!
If you're super and in a hurry here, duck-jump over the blocks above the Thwimp, then start spin jumping once you're on the other side.
Why am I bothering with this flower that I don't need?
Okay, I'm in. Also, there's a multi-coin block here, in case you care.
Wow, that koopa did not want to get clobbered! Okay, so I revealed a vine, but what good does that do? Well, if I hit the P-switch, a door appears up there!

Now, over here, in addition to the vine block, you can also find another star in this row of turn blocks. Now, don't let too many of those turn blocks be destroyed. You kind of want to cross them to reach the vine!
Yeah, you're not heading in this direction, that's for sure. Magikoopa put up maximum security pipes to seal you off from the regular game!

Fortunately, that Thwimp was in a good sprite slot to get clobbered. Now, after clearing the floor, either kick a shell at the turn block that's under the springboard up there, or get Magikoopa to hit that block for you.
Okay, I'm starting the level over and doing that again! That wasn't supposed to happen at all! (Actually, I didn't have to Start+Select there.)

Okay, good. Kicking a shell at that block is usually faster, but I had accidentally destroyed them all, so I needed to rely on Magikoopa. Now, bounce up there and hit every block! (Don't let Magikoopa hit the important ones on you first!)
